title: AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'max_n'
body:
Hello - Any ideas what is causing this error?

```
> calculating confusion matrices
    0 of 45 chunks processedmultiprocessing.pool.RemoteTraceback: 
"""
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/Matt.Parker/wc/miniconda3/envs/epi2melabs-wf-tb-amr/lib/python3.9/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 125, in worker
    result = (True, func(*args, **kwds))
  File "/Users/Matt.Parker/wc/miniconda3/envs/epi2melabs-wf-tb-amr/lib/python3.9/multiprocessing/pool.py", line 48, in mapstar
    return list(map(*args))
  File "src/bam.pyx", line 353, in bam.calc_confusion_matrices
  File "src/bam.pyx", line 362, in bam.calc_confusion_matrices
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'max_n'
"""
```
Thanks

Matt

title: Empty Sam File after ralign
body:
```
python ~/wc/npore/src/realign.py --bam <BAM> --ref <FASTA> --out_prefix <PREFIX>  --stats_dir ~/wc/npore/guppy5_stats
```
Results in an empty sam file with the only error a warning:

```
lib/python3.9/multiprocessing/resource_tracker.py:216: UserWarning: resource_tracker: There appear to be 12 leaked semaphore objects to clean up at shutdown
  warnings.warn('resource_tracker: There appear to be %d '
```
`samtools flagstat` on my bam:
```
8898 + 0 in total (QC-passed reads + QC-failed reads)
0 + 0 secondary
0 + 0 supplementary
0 + 0 duplicates
8898 + 0 mapped (100.00% : N/A)
0 + 0 paired in sequencing
0 + 0 read1
0 + 0 read2
0 + 0 properly paired (N/A : N/A)
0 + 0 with itself and mate mapped
0 + 0 singletons (N/A : N/A)
0 + 0 with mate mapped to a different chr
0 + 0 with mate mapped to a different chr (mapQ>=5)
```
Contig header line matches contig in the bam file. This is amplicon data - so only small regions of the entire genome is covered.

Any ideas?

title: Clair3 scripts and modifications
body:
Thanks for sharing this very interesting realignment approach.

I noticed that your `scripts/realign_pipeline.sh` scripts refers to some model training scripts in the `./clair3/` folder that I could not find in the repository. Would you mind sharing these scripts as well?
Also, could you provide more details of the corresponding modifications that you made to Clair3, particularly the haplotype-phased pileup calling (`clair3-hap`) that you describe in your preprint?

title: Maximum recommended homopolymer length?
body:
I am analyzing a sample with long homopolymer runs. What are the maximum recommended values for  `max_n` and `max_l` ?

Thanks!
